thread.title: Hundreds queue for free fried chicken outside new Northern Quarter restaurant - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Hundreds queue for free fried chicken outside new Northern Quarter restaurant - Manchester Evening News

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: Hundreds queue for free fried chicken outside new Northern Quarter restaurant - Manchester Evening News
text:
What's On Hundreds queue for free fried chicken outside new Northern Quarter restaurant Yard & Coop, located on Edge Street, is giving out 1000 free pieces of buttermilk chicken on Wednesday as part of its ‘Big Chook Off’ event Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Hundreds queue outside Northern Quarter chicken restaurant Share this video Get What's On updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
More than 250 hungry diners have queued up outside a Northern Quarter restaurant which is handing out free fried chicken this lunchtime. 
Yard & Coop, located on Edge Street, is giving out 1000 free pieces of buttermilk chicken on Wednesday as part of its ‘Big Chook Off’ event. 
A long queues of customers began to form outside the restaurant at midday, with the offer running on a first come first served basis. Hundreds queue for free fried chicken outside Yard & Coop (Photo: @thegingerwig) Read More The Manchester restaurant laying on free chicken dinners this month 
The restaurant confirmed there were 250 people queuing at 12.30pm on Wednesday. 
Images and video shared on social media sites shows hundreds of diners lining up around the corner of the venue. 
One Twitter user posted an image of the queue and wrote: “The things people do for free chicken.” 
Fern Berry wrote: “Everyone’s mad for the chicken.” 
Yard & Coop have said they will continue to dish out the free portions of buttermilk chicken from noon until midnight - or until they run out. Read More
